thread.title: Watch: Chris Kaman 'a little crazy,' 'a lot different' but a key mentor for young Trail Blazers
thread.title_full: Watch: Chris Kaman 'a little crazy,' 'a lot different' but a key mentor for young Trail Blazers | OregonLive.com

author: Sean Meagher | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Watch: Chris Kaman 'a little crazy,' 'a lot different' but a key mentor for young Trail Blazers
text:
As the oldest member of the revamped Portland Trail Blazers , Chris Kaman has a lot to offer about life in the NBA after 12 seasons.
And to his younger teammates, the 33-year-old former All-Star is serving as a valuable mentor for a roster with an average age of just under 24.
"Chris has been fantastic," Blazers coach Terry Stotts said of his veteran center. "He's been talking to all the young guys, big or little. He's embraced the role that he has with this team."
Adds Meyers Leonard : "He's a great teammate, a great guy. He's a little crazy but he's got my back no matter what. He cares."
In the video above, Stotts, Leonard and newcomers Mason Plumlee, Noah Vonleh and Ed Davis talk about what Kaman brings to the Blazers.
